III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an ISEP violation. Please note that there
are additional ISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility
is in compliance with all additional ISEP requirements except for the following:
This is a non-contracted facility and therefore not required to follow ISEP.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a MDHHS Contract/Policy violation. Please
note that there are additional MDHHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not
be included in section 1. The facility is in compliance with all additional MDHHS
Contract/Policy requirements except for the following:
This is a non-contracted facility and therefore not required to follow MDHHS policy.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility did not require technical assistance during this review.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility did not request consultation during this review.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
The facility has submitted two acceptable corrective action plans not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period.
On 5/18/18 special investigation 2018C0212012 was initiated (CAP approved
1/28/19). This investigation was initiated due to an allegation that a staff member was
allowing residents of the home to have girls over and engage in sexual activity in the
house. The facility was found to be in violation rule R400.4109 (1,c) Program
Statement and R400.4112 (1,a) Staff Qualifications. Additional findings were cited
due to confirming that the staff in question was also placed on central registry in
2014. This was missed by the agency, due to the staff being hired in an adult program
where a central registry check is not completed; then transferring to the children’s
program in 2018, without the ‘new hire’ process being completed. The facility was
cited for Staff Qualifications, Rule 400.4112. Since that time, the agency has
terminated this person’s employment. The agency has also implemented a process
1

for all staff transferring into the children’s program, to ensure that proper clearances
are provided. Policies regarding visitors and supervision of residents at the house
have also been updated. The facility continues to follow their CAP and there have
been no further incidents.
On 6/3/19 special investigation 2019C0212032 was initiated (CAP approved 8/29/19).
The investigation was initiated after it was reported that a resident assaulted another
resident during sleeping hours, without staff knowledge. The facility was found to be
in violation of R 400.4127 staff-to-resident ratio. Per the CAP, the facility implemented
a policy requiring staff to remain in the upstairs hallway during sleeping hours, to
ensure residents remain in their bedrooms. The facility reports that they continue to
utilize this policy and there have not been any additional incidents.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. It is recommended that the facility continue on their regular license.
